results.text: You’ve proven that you aren’t a threat, at least for now. You have advantage on the next Animal Handling check against the target creature.
Your presence bolsters the creature’s resolve. The target creature gains an expertise die to resist fear for the next hour.
You arrange the weight on the creature’s back to help it along. The creature’s carrying capacity is doubled for the next 24 hours.
Your guidance helps steer the creature on the safest path. The target creature cannot be knocked prone as a result of difficult terrain. This benefit lasts until you complete a long rest.

Through your gentle hands or the prodding of your heels, the creature feels as if it can accomplish the impossible. The next time the creature must make a check to accomplish a task, it makes the roll at advantage.
Trust is hard-earned and hard-won. The creature you are currently handling gains the loyal property from the mount traits table for the next 24 hours.
